meanings.definition: To interpret in a new or different way.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys reinterpreting stories to make them more exciting.
meanings.sent2: The artist is reinterpreting a classic painting with a modern twist.
meanings.sent3: He kept reinterpreting the instructions, causing confusion among his friends.
meanings.sent4: Her unique perspective on life allows her to constantly be reinterpreting the world around her.
meanings.sent5: By reinterpreting the data, the scientist discovered a new pattern.

meanings.definition: To explain or understand in a different way.
meanings.sent1: The teacher is reinterpreting the lesson to help students understand better.
meanings.sent2: By reinterpreting the evidence, the detective solved the case.
meanings.sent3: The comedian had a funny way of reinterpreting everyday situations.
meanings.sent4: She was reinterpreting his silence as a sign of agreement.
meanings.sent5: Reinterpreting the map, she found a quicker route to her destination.

meanings.definition: To give a new or different meaning to.
meanings.sent1: The poet is reinterpreting traditional poems to reflect modern society.
meanings.sent2: By reinterpreting the lyrics, the singer brought a fresh perspective to the song.
meanings.sent3: The children were reinterpreting the rules of the game to suit their preferences.
meanings.sent4: His actions were reinterpreting the definition of bravery.
meanings.sent5: Reinterpreting history can provide new insights into past events.
